confession.seduction_date: 20 years before (later changed to 7 years, then 2-3 years - inconsistent)

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Benoist Mathieu
timeline.details: Procureur d'office for canons of Saint Dié orders investigation

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Benoist Mathieu
timeline.details: First interrogation (date uncertain, marked as 6 (?) June)

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Benoist Mathieu
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses; denied all charges

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Benoist Mathieu
timeline.details: Procureur d'office asks for question ordinaire

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Benoist Mathieu
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves use of thumbscrews

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Benoist Mathieu
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - given thumbscrews then racked; confessed to seduction by Persin, receiving powders, malefices, sabbat attendance

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Benoist Mathieu
timeline.details: Post-torture interrogation - confirmed confessions, added Persin wanted communion wafers

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Benoist Mathieu
timeline.details: Denied all confessions; offered to pay 100 ecus for release

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Benoist Mathieu
timeline.details: Procureur d'office asks for execution due to sufficient proof

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Benoist Mathieu
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to execution only if she freely admits guilt

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Benoist Mathieu
timeline.details: Continued denials; procureur d'office asks for renewed torture

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Benoist Mathieu
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves renewed torture

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Benoist Mathieu
timeline.details: Second torture session - racked; repeated earlier confessions

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Benoist Mathieu
timeline.details: Confirmed essential confession but denied some malefices; placed seduction 7 years before

timeline.subject: Catherine femme Benoist Mathieu
timeline.details: Change de Nancy confirms death sentence

torture.requesting_official: Procureur d'office for canons of Saint Dié

accomplices_named.name: Simonne wife of Mathieu Jean Benay Sterbey

prior_accusations.context: Had heard her brother say she was a witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Jenotte femme Jean Sterbey (witness 2)
notable_quotes.french: elle yroit au conseil ou elle pouvoit mieulx pour le faire ramener
notable_quotes.english: she would go to council or wherever she could to have it remedied

notable_quotes.speaker: Simonne femme Mathieu Jean Benay Sterbey (witness 3)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle s'estoit enquis du profit qu'elle faisoit en mesnage, ad cause de ses fromages, mais qu'elle s'en repentiroit
notable_quotes.english: that she had inquired about the profit she made in household from her cheeses, but that she would regret it

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine (accused, beating cow)
notable_quotes.french: le diable ne ta il pas encore emporte, tu y yras
notable_quotes.english: hasn't the devil taken you yet, you will go there
notable_quotes.context: Witness 3 saw Catherine beat her cow with stick

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Jacquot (witness 9)
notable_quotes.french: que sy elle estoit sorciere, elle le feroit mourir. Mais adjousta qu'elle n'en avoit la puissance
notable_quotes.english: that if she were a witch, she would make him die. But added that she did not have the power

notable_quotes.speaker: Mathieu Sterby (witness 10)
notable_quotes.french: elle donna des maledictions, disant que mal profit en peut il faire
notable_quotes.english: she gave curses, saying that ill profit may it do him

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehennon femme Mengeon Pierron (witness 16)
notable_quotes.french: coustumiere de donner des imprecations et maledictions, tant a son marit qu'autres, et est son desir veoir ses jouissance, quand elle veoit son prochain en necessité, soit par famine ou autrement
notable_quotes.english: accustomed to give curses and maledictions, both to her husband and others, and it is her desire to see her enjoyment when she sees her neighbor in necessity, whether by famine or otherwise

notable_quotes.speaker: Marie femme Pierron Jean Thiery (witness 19)
notable_quotes.french: les gens de la grande fosse seroient bien joyeulx quand on la meneroit brusler, et qu'elle auroit bien chaud
notable_quotes.english: the people of la Grandefosse would be very joyful when she would be led to burn, and that she would be very hot

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine (accused)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle donneroit volontier de son bien a ses enfans, mais que s'ils devenoyent malade, l'on auroit soubcon d'elle, pour ce que l'on l'estime sorciere (quoy que a tort)
notable_quotes.english: that she would willingly give her goods to her children, but if they became sick, one would have suspicion of her, because she is considered a witch (though wrongly)

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine (accused)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elles sont sorcieres sy elle l'est, et qu'on les fait venir pour estre bruslée avec elle, et que nous serons quitte de recommencer
notable_quotes.english: that they are witches if she is, and that they should be brought to be burned with her, and that we will be quit of beginning again
notable_quotes.context: About those she accused at sabbat

economic_context.details: Inheritance dispute with Demenge Jacquot arising from fact that her husband was 'frere non germain' of his late wife. Property boundary dispute with Simonne over pasture area. Multiple incidents suggest economic strain: cheese sales disputes, concern over profit from dairy, envy over neighbors' livestock wealth. Catherine described as wife of 'poor laboureur'. Witnesses note her desire to know about others' economic success and her envy of neighbors' prosperity.

harms_catalog.victim_name: horse belonging to maire Demenge Mathieu
harms_catalog.harm_description: Strong horse had back leg stuck, injured itself while ploughing before dawn
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: None stated - Catherine was in neighboring field
harms_catalog.method_alleged: proximity - she was seen in neighboring field

harms_catalog.victim_name: cow belonging to Jenotte femme Jean Sterbey
harms_catalog.harm_description: Cow giving plenty of milk suddenly dropped yield badly - from cheese every other day to small cheese every week
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Jenotte complained to Catherine, saying she would go to council to have it remedied
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft; cured when Jenotte talked to Catherine's sister-in-law about taking cow to accused's house

harms_catalog.victim_name: cow held from curé of Serainville
harms_catalog.harm_description: Cow became ill
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Catherine angry about cheese sales at Provencheres, denied selling any, accused Simonne of inquiring about her household profit
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft; cured by taking 3 kinds of herbs from Catherine's garden

harms_catalog.victim_name: cow held from curé of Serainville
harms_catalog.harm_description: After initial recovery, cow eventually died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Simonne put cow to pasture in area adjoining Catherine's property over which there had been disputes
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Catherine came out with stick and beat cow, saying 'hasn't the devil taken you yet, you will go there'

harms_catalog.victim_relationship_to_witness: young man from village brought to witness's house

harms_catalog.attributed_to: Catherine or Cathelo of la Grandefosse
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Catherine asked him for cherries while he was collecting them, warned him to be careful not to fall, gave him grease for shoes
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: fell ill same day as receiving grease
harms_catalog.method_alleged: grease for shoes given as thanks for cherries

harms_catalog.harm_description: Fell ill same day, languished throughout harvest, died unable to eat and having lost voice
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Catherine asked for cherries, remarked he was very high and should be careful not to fall, gave him grease for shoes
harms_catalog.method_alleged: grease for shoes looked unusual; mother warned him but he used it anyway

harms_catalog.victim_name: best cow belonging to Jean Pieron household
harms_catalog.victim_relationship_to_witness: witness's parents' cow (witness lived with parents)
harms_catalog.harm_description: In stable next to kitchen, lay down and died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Catherine came to ask for light (raidy de sapin), not given as quickly as expected; father remarked she borrowed very often
harms_catalog.method_alleged: proximity - took light from house

harms_catalog.harm_description: Horse died in two days
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Took 'fuelles' to feed horses from Catherine's garden; Catherine complained about seed-bearing ones
harms_catalog.method_alleged: eating fuelles from Catherine's garden

harms_catalog.harm_description: Died in an hour and a half after being taken to water
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Catherine took raidy de sapin from house
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Catherine's husband came next morning to preemptively deny 'sa sotte' had caused death

harms_catalog.victim_name: calf (best of three fine calves a year old)
harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill, stopped eating, had to be taken to fields 'pour le faire deshabiler'
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Catherine envious, appeared to stroke calves while witness was feeding them with hay
harms_catalog.method_alleged: touch - appeared to stroke them

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lingered for some time before death
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Inheritance dispute and envy of property; wife often quarreled with Catherine
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft - both women said if Catherine were witch, she gave them 'le morceau de la mort' due to envy

harms_catalog.harm_description: Died after year's illness
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Inheritance dispute and envy
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft

harms_catalog.harm_description: Sickened, languished some weeks, died on eve of Ascension
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Cow escaped and damaged her garden
harms_catalog.method_alleged: curses - 'elle donna des maledictions, disant que mal profit en peut il faire'

harms_catalog.harm_description: Complained of stomach pains, only worked half a day, forced to return home, died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Catherine gave him grease for shoes as thanks for cherries
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: fell ill same day as receiving grease
harms_catalog.method_alleged: grease for shoes - Nicolas said he believed Catherine bewitched him with it

harms_catalog.victim_relationship_to_witness: witness's daughter about to be married
harms_catalog.harm_description: Threatened death before marriage feast
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Catherine asked witness about investigation when someone went to St. Dié; he was unwilling to help
harms_catalog.method_alleged: threat/curse

harms_catalog.harm_description: Sudden death
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Catherine came repeatedly asking for raidy de sapin for nightly use where wick light couldn't keep flame; refused once or twice but finally yielded
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Catherine's husband came next morning though they hadn't talked of her

harms_catalog.victim_name: cow belonging to Nicolas de Flabeprey
harms_catalog.victim_relationship_to_witness: hearsay - heard from Nicolas de Flabeprey
harms_catalog.harm_description: Fine cow died
harms_catalog.economic_value: worth 12 ecus (German wanted to buy it)

harms_catalog.method_alleged: Catherine's words - told him he would have done well to sell the cow

harms_catalog.harm_description: Lost three calves
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Catherine asked witness to wait for her after mass at Provencheres; witness did not, not thinking Catherine was speaking to her
harms_catalog.method_alleged: threat - told she would repent

harms_catalog.harm_description: Feared barrenness - no children while 2 other daughters had children

harms_catalog.victim_name: fine cow belonging to Nicolas de Flabeprey
harms_catalog.harm_description: Fine cow died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: German wanted to buy for 12 ecus, could only pay 9 down; witness refused credit, sold different cow for 9
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Catherine's words when he passed her house - 'he would have done well to sell the cow'

Devil gave her for animals - confession under torture
Devil gave her for animals - confession under torture
Persin wanted her to bring him these, especially at Easter; she refused and was beaten

weather_events: hail on two occasions when local crops were badly damaged (mentioned in confession)
economic_hardship_indicators: witness 16 mentions Catherine's desire to see neighbors in necessity by famine or otherwise

officials_named.name: Procureur d'office for canons of Saint Dié

prior_legal_disputes.description: First husband Jean Knecht detained in prison at Tainctru with his chambriere whom he had impregnated; they killed the child and chambriere was executed by gibbet at ban de Sapt; he escaped and died abroad
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Chambriere executed; Jean Knecht escaped and died abroad

prior_legal_disputes.description: Jenotte attributed cow's sickness to Catherine 'l'appellant presque ouvertement sorciere' - Catherine and husband threatened to seek reparation at Saint Dié but nothing came of it
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Nothing came of threat to seek reparation

legal_context.redress_outcome: Catherine and husband threatened to seek reparation at Saint Dié for being called witch but nothing came of this
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Catherine told guards she would give 100 ecus to be released and allowed to go to Germany

change_de_nancy.modification_details: First approved torture (thumbscrews) on June 11. On June 20, agreed to execution only if she freely admitted guilt. On July 4, approved renewed torture. On July 12, confirmed death sentence.

hearsay_chains.content: During illness Nicolas constantly said he was bewitched by Catherine or Cathelo of la Grandefosse
He fell ill on same day and languished throughout harvest before death
Catherine asked if he had sold his cow; when he said no, she said he would have done well to do so; three days later it died
Had heard her brother say she was a witch

emotional_state_notes: lamenting about her fate - told witness 19 people would be joyful when she was burned
aware of reputation and its effects - told witness 18 she couldn't give gifts to children because she'd be suspected if they became sick
defiant during retractions - said those she accused were witches if she was
offered bribes - told guards she'd pay 100 ecus to be released, claimed 3 relatives would each pay 100 ecus
preferred to be burned at la Grandefosse rather than publicly at St. Dié

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Said the devil had caused death of Nicolas Gaux (deflecting blame)
Said she had always helped people of la Grandefosse

third_parties.name: Nicolas Gaust (Colas Gaux, Nicolas le Gaux)
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: son of witness 5; companion of witness 10
third_parties.context: Young man who died after harvest, allegedly bewitched by Catherine via grease for shoes

third_parties.name: Benoist Mathieu (Catherine's husband)
third_parties.context: Described as poor laboureur; sent by Catherine to preemptively deny she caused cow deaths; half-brother of Demenge Jacquot's late wife

third_parties.name: Jean Knecht (first husband)
third_parties.context: Married only 12-13 weeks, never lived with Catherine due to 'sort' placed between them; detained at Tainctru with chambriere, escaped and died abroad

third_parties.name: Mansuy des Folz
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: gave her the 'sort' affecting first marriage
third_parties.context: From ban de Sapt, reputed sorcerer; allegedly placed spell between Catherine and Jean Knecht because he wanted Knecht for his daughter

third_parties.name: Demenge Mathieu (maire)
third_parties.context: Mayor of la Grandefosse; employer of Estienne Hidoult

third_parties.name: Jean Charrey
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: went to St. Dié to seek action against her
third_parties.context: Individual from village who went to St. Dié to ask for investigation of Catherine

third_parties.name: Claudon Agathe
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: went to St. Dié to seek action against her
third_parties.context: Went to St. Dié with Jean Charrey to seek action against Catherine; father of witness 7; widower

third_parties.name: curé of Serainville
third_parties.context: Owned cow that Simonne (witness 3) held and that allegedly died from Catherine's witchcraft

third_parties.name: Jean Cognolle
third_parties.context: Married to witness 15's daughter who Catherine allegedly made barren

third_parties.name: wife of Demenge Henry of la Fontenelle
third_parties.context: Exiled to Germany after being accused of witchcraft at Tainctru; Catherine referenced her case when offering to leave country

third_parties.name: Persin (devil)
third_parties.context: Name of devil in confession; seduced Catherine allegedly 20 years before (or 7 years, or 2-3 years - inconsistent); gave her three kinds of powder; cold nature; wanted communion wafers

third_parties.name: German buyer
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: wanted to buy cow from witness 17
third_parties.context: Wanted to buy Nicolas de Flabeprey's fine cow for 12 ecus but could only pay 9 down

third_parties.name: Jehennon fille Claude Agathe
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: mentioned in witness 1's testimony as claiming Catherine killed their 'chalbry'
third_parties.context: Mentioned by witness 1 as having claimed Catherine killed their animal; also testified as witness 7

third_parties.name: chambriere of Jean Knecht
third_parties.context: Impregnated by Jean Knecht; they killed child; she was executed by gibbet at ban de Sapt

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a complex trial with extensive witness testimony and multiple torture sessions. Key uncertainties and notable features: 1) Catherine's confession timeline is inconsistent - she variously claimed seduction occurred 20 years, 7 years, 3 years, and 2 years before; the judges suggested confusion with her first husband. 2) The exact date of first interrogation is uncertain (marked as '6 (?) June'). 3) Catherine repeatedly retracted confessions between torture sessions. 4) Notable healing counter-magic: villagers took herbs from Catherine's garden to cure bewitched animals - this was described as customary village practice. 5) Economic context is prominent: cheese-making disputes, inheritance conflicts, property boundaries, envy of neighbors' livestock. 6) Catherine's husband's preemptive denials are unusual - he came to neighbors to say 'sa sotte' hadn't caused deaths before being accused. 7) The trial shows awareness of witchcraft law: Catherine tried to seek legal redress for being called witch; she knew offering bribes; she preferred private execution over public. 8) Change de Nancy was closely involved, requiring free confession for execution. 9) Four witnesses named as accomplices seen at sabbat - three were also witnesses against Catherine (Simonne, Claudatte, Jehennon fille Agathe) and one was related to a witness (Cathelon femme Benay Sterbey). 10) Economic status assessed as 'poor' based on husband described as 'poor laboureur' and overall economic conflicts in testimony.
